newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine government offers hand to shipbuilders.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine government offers hand to shipbuilders.

text.p: The Ukrainian government has launched a process which could eventually lead to hundreds of millions of dollars in foreign credits reaching the country's struggling shipbuilders, investment sources said on Friday.
"This would be the first capital markets type investment of its kind in Ukraine, though legislation still has to be passed," one source said.

Prime Minister Pavlo Lazarenko on May 20 ordered the National Agency for Reconstruction and Development to look into offering a state guarantee on credits from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development and Merrill Lynch to yards at the Black Sea port of Mykolayev, a government document showed.

The government also told the State Property Fund to start the process of privatising two of the shipyards -- Chornomorsky Sudnobudivny Zavod (CSZ) and Sudnobudivny Zavod Imeni 61 Comunara which have been building hulls for Greek firms.
Two Greek companies have been building ships at Chornomorsky Sudnobudivny Zavod (CSZ) and Sudnobudivny Zavod Imeni 61 Comunara, the sources said.

Merrill Lynch would initially provide more than $50 million in credits to each yard to build six product tankers at CSZ and five refrigerator vessels at 61 Comunara over five years for contracts already signed with the Greek companies -- if legislation was passed to support the deal, one source said.
